required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Defining the Conjunctival Staining Method: Instillation Volume and Time Course to Assess Staining With Lissamine Green

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the correct volume of lissamine green to use when assessing conjunctival staining, and to determine the time course needed to evaluate conjunctival staining after lissamine green has been instilled in the eye.

primary_outcome.description: Lissamine green was instilled in each eye. Conjunctival staining was assessed by the investigator in the nasal and temporal sections. The Oxford Scheme was used for each section, with a possible score of 0-5 for each section, where 0=absent and 5=severe. The nasal and temporal scores were summed, for a possible score of 0-10 for each eye. Each subject was represented by a single eye, referred to as the "study eye." The study eye was defined as the eye that attained the highest stain at any measurement time point during the screening visit.

Lissamine green was instilled in each eye. Conjunctival staining was assessed by the investigator in the nasal and temporal sections. The Oxford Scheme was used for each section, with a possible score of 0-5 for each section, where 0=absent and 5=severe. The nasal and temporal scores were summed, for a possible score of 0-10 for each eye. Each subject was represented by a single eye, referred to as the "study eye." The study eye was defined as the eye that attained the highest stain at any measurement time point during the screening visit.

The nasal and temporal scores were summed, for a possible score of 0-10 for each eye. Each subject was represented by a single eye, referred to as the "study eye." The study eye was defined as the eye that attained the highest stain at any measurement time point during the screening visit.

Lissamine green was instilled in each eye. Conjunctival staining was assessed by the investigator in the nasal and temporal sections. The Oxford Scheme was used for each section, with a possible score of 0-5 for each section, where 0=absent and 5=severe. The nasal and temporal scores were summed, for a possible score of 0-10 for each eye. Each subject was represented by a single eye, referred to as the "study eye." The study eye was defined as the eye that attained the highest stain at any measurement time point during the screening visit.

Lissamine green was instilled in each eye. Conjunctival staining was assessed by the investigator in the nasal and temporal sections. The Oxford Scheme was used for each section, with a possible score of 0-5 for each section, where 0=absent and 5=severe. The nasal and temporal scores were summed, for a possible score of 0-10 for each eye. Each subject was represented by a single eye, referred to as the "study eye." The study eye was defined as the eye that attained the highest stain at any measurement time point during the screening visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- conjunctival staining
Exclusion Criteria:
- ocular pathology

facility.name: Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 30 subjects with conjunctival staining and no other ocular pathology were recruited and enrolled.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This reporting group includes all enrolled participants.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
